Kevin,

Well, I did check in everything for version 1.7.1, but I haven't  
announced that it is ready... so there may be some small glitches  
like you are finding that we need to fix. It is odd though, since I  
use a powerbook configured much like yours and it works fine for me.   
It seems to be some problem in finding data files. Try enabling the  
debug flag in importPhase:

gas = importPhase("frac.cti", debug = 1)

This might tell you something.

Dave


On May 8, 2007, at 9:17 AM, kevinmwalters wrote:

> I'm having a little trouble building Cantera 1.7.1 from cvs on my
> machine (PowerBook G4, ppc, OSX 10.4.9, Python 2.5.1, numarray, gcc,
> sundials 2.3).
>
> Running the "preconfig" script (unchanged), "make" and "make install"
> seems to go fine without any warnings/errors.  However, when I run
> "make test", or any script that uses importPhase, I get the following
> error...
> ___________________________________
>
> Procedure: get_XML_File
> Error:   cannot open ./diamond.xml for reading.Note, this error
> indicates a possible configuration problem.
> Error opening up file1, diamond.csv
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "frac.py", line 7, in <module>
>     gas = importPhase('frac.cti')
>   File
> "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/ 
> site-packages/Cantera/importFromFile.py",
> line 20, in importPhase
>     return importPhases(file, [name], loglevel, debug)[0]
>   File
> "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/ 
> site-packages/Cantera/importFromFile.py",
> line 27, in importPhases
>
> s.append(solution.Solution 
> (src=file,id=nm,loglevel=loglevel,debug=debug))
>   File
> "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/ 
> site-packages/Cantera/solution.py",
> line 39, in __init__
>     preprocess = 1, debug = debug)
>   File
> "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.5/lib/python2.5/ 
> site-packages/Cantera/XML.py",
> line 35, in __init__
>     self._xml_id = _cantera.xml_get_XML_File(src, debug)
> cantera.error:
>
> ************************************************
>                 Cantera Error!
> ************************************************
> ___________________________________
>
> Any ideas how to resolve this?  Is preconfig missing something?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Kevin
>
